title: Matchsafe, "with Pocket Knife", 1881–82
markings: Unidentified maker's mark (L.D), duty mark, lion passant stamped on exterior of underside; L.D, lion passant, date letter "E" stamped on underside of lid; L.D, lion passant, city mark,  date letter and duty mark all stamped on interior bottom.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Elongated oval shape, flat, undecorated front and reverse surfaces, featuring small knife and button hook that swing out from left and right concealed slots on underside. Link attached to end. Lid (box cover on front) hinged on long, button hook side. Striker also on long side beneath hinge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "with Pocket Knife", 1881–82.
1881–82. Silver, gilding, metal. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-1267.
